subject: Art & Design
title: Visual Storytelling: One Frame, One Narrative
description: A micro-lesson that makes Visual Storytelling: One Frame, One Narrative usable.

hook.text: A single photo of shoes outside a door tells a story of arrival, expectation, or tradition.

buildup.text: Storytelling photos include context clues: environment, body language, juxtaposition, and decisive timing.

discovery.text: The best photos raise questions. 'Who is this person? What just happened? What's about to happen?'

twist.text: A photo that answers every question is a document. A photo that raises questions is art.

climax.text: Photojournalists compress entire human experiences into single frames. One image can change policy.

punchline.text: A photo doesn't record a moment. It creates a question about one.

quiz.question: What makes a photograph feel like it tells a story?
options: Context clues, body language, and questions it raises in the viewer
Including text captions in the image
